ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:0.4_0: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:0.5_0: The second training rule on lifted robe
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were lifting their robe while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lift my robe while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.4_0: One should not lift one’s robe while sitting in an inhabited area.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, lifts his robe on one or both sides while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.15_0: The tenth rule, the training rule on tenth rule, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.16_0: The first sub-chapter on evenly all around is finished.
